result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nevaeh M Green

records.addlTxt: Bench warrant was not sent to Warrants,  held off for 10/21/22 hearing.  Defendant does appears and matter is scheduled.

Defendant Nevaeh M Green in court, via zoom.  Attorney Jennifer M. Gaecke in court for Nevaeh M Green, via zoom.  Prosecuting attorney Tim Greenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Per CC Vopal - Defendant and Attorney Gaecke may appear via zoom due the circumstances stated in the letter.
Request to Appear via Zoom
Attorney called to schedule RW.  Advised in person, date, time, and location.
Return on warrant on October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:24 am - Defendant Nevaeh M Green not in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Gaecke in court for Nevaeh M Green.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin L Steuck in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court authorizes forthwith bench warrant.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Kari Hoffman in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nevaeh M Green appeared by video.  Attorney Jennifer M. Gaecke appeared by video for Nevaeh M Green.   Bond cont.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Nevaeh M Green in court with attorney Jennifer M. Gaecke appear via zoom.  Defendant under house arrest in Milwaukee.
Asst. District Attorney Eric Enli appears on behalf of the State.
Present bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Per BC Support Services Division/Redi Transport, Ms. Green was being released from Milwaukee and, as a result, would not be brought to Green Bay via the writ.  Redi Transport gave the officer in Milwaukee County the information off the writ so she would appear on her own. - JE

Defendant Nevaeh M Green not in court.  Counsel not present.  
Asst. District Attorney Kimberly Hardtke appears on behalf of the State.
Clerk of Court tried to schedule a zoom conference for the upcoming Preliminary Hearing, however Milwaukee would not schedule, advised to call day of hearing to see if there was room.  
Court requested State prepare a writ so defedant will be present for upcoming 05/03/22 Preliminary Hearing.
Left voice mail message for defense counsel advising Milwaukee will not allow defendant to appear via zoom for her upcoming Prelminiary Hearing so the court approved a writ.  - JE

Called Milwaukee Juv. Center to schedule Zoom or Phone Conf. MKE stated that I would have to call the morning of the hearing to see if they had time. This information was relayed to parties involved for next hearing...AA

Defendant Nevaeh M Green in court with attorney Jennifer M. Gaecke. Defendant in custody at Milwaukee Juv. Center. District Attorney David Lasee appears on behalf of the State.  Present bond continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Per call from attorney, defendant and attorney will be appearing via zoom, defendant possibly in custody in Milwaukee.
Appointing Jennifer Gaecke
Posted 4-1-22
